column5: Sample Question
column6: Example Prospect Answer

column5: “What do you think created this issue?”
column6: “It’s because of my parents / society / bad luck.”

column5: “Have you played any role in how this has continued?”
column6: “Maybe... I’ve avoided dealing with it.”

column5: “Who’s ultimately responsible for where things are now?”
column6: “I am. I’ve made choices that led here.”

column5: “What’s causing this problem?”
column6: “The market is tough / sales just aren’t closing.”

column5: “Where does your team fit into the problem?”
column6: “Some internal processes are messy — part of it’s on us.”

column5: “How accountable is your team for this issue?”
column6: “We’ve let this slip — and we’re responsible for fixing it.”

column5: “Why hasn’t the home sold yet?”
column6: “The market’s bad. Buyers are flaky.”

column5: “Do you feel you’ve done everything possible to sell?”
column6: “Not really — we didn’t do much prep.”

column5: “What role have you played in the current situation?”
column6: “We priced high and delayed showings — that’s on us.”

column5: “Whose job is it to fix this?”
column6: “I hope someone helps me... I can’t do it alone.”

column5: “Are you the one who will drive this change?”
column6: “I think so — I just don’t know how yet.”

column5: “Who’s ultimately responsible for solving this?”
column6: “Me. It starts with me taking action.”

column5: “What needs to happen for this to change?”
column6: “We need someone else to come in and shake things up.”

column5: “Is your team in a position to drive this forward?”
column6: “We could — with the right support.”

column5: “Who owns the solution from your side?”
column6: “We do. We’ll lead internally with external help.”

column5: “What’s needed to sell this home?”
column6: “Hopefully a buyer comes along.”

column5: “Are you ready to take new action if needed?”
column6: “Yes — but I’d want more advice first.”

column5: “Who’s driving the result here?”
column6: “We are — and we’re ready to do what’s needed.”

column5: “Do you believe you can truly change this?”
column6: “Honestly, no. I’ve tried and failed.”

column5: “What’s your confidence in solving this?”
column6: “I think I can... with the right help.”

column5: “Do you trust yourself to make this shift?”
column6: “Yes. I’ve overcome bigger things. I know I can.”

column5: “Does your team have the ability to fix this?”
column6: “Not without a major overhaul.”

column5: “Do you believe this is solvable internally?”
column6: “Maybe — we’ll need strong support.”

column5: “Do you believe your team can implement this solution?”
column6: “Yes — we’re capable if the right pieces are in place.”

column5: “Do you believe you can get the sale you want?”
column6: “Not really. It feels impossible.”

column5: “Do you think your plan can work with support?”
column6: “Yes, if I have help.”

column5: “Are you confident you can make this happen?”
column6: “Yes — I know what to do now.”

column5: “How well do you stick with things you commit to?”
column6: “I struggle — I lose momentum fast.”

column5: “How’s your follow-through on goals?”
column6: “Inconsistent. I try, but sometimes give up.”

column5: “Do you trust yourself to follow through?”
column6: “Yes. When I say yes, I do it.”

column5: “How consistent is your team with execution?”
column6: “We start things… but don’t always finish.”

column5: “What’s your team’s follow-through like?”
column6: “We mean well, but competing priorities get in the way.”

column5: “Can your team follow through on this commitment?”
column6: “Yes — if we commit, we deliver.”

column5: “Do you follow through on what you say you’ll do?”
column6: “Not always — I tend to delay.”

column5: “How reliable are you when it comes to financial or legal tasks?”
column6: “I get them done eventually.”

column5: “Can I count on you to execute what’s needed?”
column6: “Yes. I’m a person of my word.”

column5: “Why do you think this program is worth the price?”
column6: “I hope it finally fixes me — it worked for others.”

column5: “What makes you think this could help you?”
column6: “It might work… if I actually apply it.”

column5: “Why are you confident this will pay off?”
column6: “If I apply it, I know I’ll change things for good.”

column5: “What kind of return are you expecting from this?”
column6: “If your team delivers, we should get results.”

column5: “What makes this investment feel smart?”
column6: “If our managers implement it right, it should help.”

column5: “Why do you believe this is the right investment for your team?”
column6: “With full adoption, we’ll exceed ROI.”

column5: “Why list at this commission?”
column6: “I hope you can sell it fast and get a good offer.”

column5: “What makes you believe this listing strategy will work?”
column6: “If the market cooperates, it should sell.”

column5: “Why are you confident in the value of your investment?”
column6: “If we execute our plan, we’ll hit our number.”
